title: All-Language Questionnaire
description: These are questions apply to any language, and should be included
tags: WebApp, API, MessageServer, iOS, Android, Electron, WindowsPhone

General: We are using a company-standard language, or we have checked in with the security team about using another language. Current supported languages are PHP, JavaScript, Java, C/C++ and Go
We are using the best language for our project/functionality and it is considered supported and well-maintained

submodules.title: PHP Language Guidance
submodules.description: PHP can be difficult to get right.  Here are some trouble spots that can trip up some projects

Shell Execution: Our project doesn't use eval, system, passthru, shell_exec, or backticks
XSS: XSS - Our application does not echo, print, or var_dump raw html or user content to the page

XSS.text: XSS - We do not render json without utilizing the `json_encode` function
XSS.explanation: Instead of generating JSON via string concatenation, please utilize the native PHP functions to ensure everything is escaped correctly

Shell Execution: My project doesn't use subprocess, or os.system
XSS: XSS - My application does not `print`, or reflect raw html or user content to the page

XSS.text: XSS - We do not render json without utilizing the `JSON` library's `json.dumps` function
XSS.explanation: Instead of generating JSON via string concatenation, please utilize the native Python functions to ensure everything is escaped correctly

submodules.title: C/C++ Language Guidance
submodules.description: C and C++ guidance for common traps

General: We confirm that we really, really need to use a non-memory-safe language.
We carefully check the read and write length inside the buffer's boundary and there's no reading or writing outside of the indented memory bounds to prevent buffer overflow.
